website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive and easy to use brewer with a durable construction.
cons: Does not hold as much water as other units

website_summaries.verdict: While it may not be as durable as other options, this is an affordable iced coffee maker that comes in a couple of different sizes.
pros: Container is BPA-free with a nonslip silicone handle and leak-proof lid
Brewed coffee stays fresh up to 2 weeks
cons: A fair amount of sediment gets past the filter
Airtight seal can break easily, and the spout could be better (spills some)

website_summaries.verdict: While the Takeya Cold Brew Coffee Maker won't satisfy drinkers of strong coffee, its low price and solid brewing chops will make budget shoppers happy.
pros: The Takeya Cold Brew Coffee Maker is affordable, easy to use and a snap to clean, and uses fewer beans to create tasty iced coffee
It's also small enough to conveniently fit inside refrigerator doors
cons: Though it uses less coffee grounds per batch, the Takeya Cold Brew Coffee Maker brews a weaker drink than other home cold-brew gadgets

customer_reviews.title: Leaks and coffee is weak
customer_reviews.text: First, the pitcher leaks from the very beginning. I could not place it on its side as instructed because there was a steady drip, even after making sure the lid was on tight. Then, for the amount of ground that goes in to make the coffee, there is hardly any flavor to the coffee. I can get more doing what I've always done: brewing bold coffee and pouring it over ice. Definitely not worth even half of what I paid!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Product started leaking shortly after starting to use it.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this product, but it started to have a slow leak only after 1 week of use. The instructions say to store it on its side in the refrigerator. Unfortunately, it has a very small leak and after cold brewing for 18 hours, it'll leak about 4 ounces or so. Otherwise it was a good product, the filter kept out most grounds if you grind course.
customer_reviews.author: E McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Check it before you use it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because it was Amazon Recommended and caused me a lot of headache. Manufacturing defect caused it to leak all the coffee out onto carpet in my office two days in a row. First time I thought it was my fault, then I looked at the seal and a piece of plastic not trimmed from the cap was causing the silicon not to seal against the lid. Definitely getting a refund and/or replacement. Considering having them pay for my carpet cleaning or replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Mark_901

customer_reviews.title: Beware! It leaks and makes a mess!
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviews, this leaks when placed on its side which is what the manufacturer recommends. What as intended as a nifty gift for my husband has turned into major frustration for him. Very disappointed. To add. Filling with water is challenging. Since the filter displaces any water in the pitcher, if one over fills the pitcher, water pours out, if one under fills the pitcher, one must remove the soggy-dripping filter to add more. I'll have to determine the proper amount and measure it. An extra step which would have been obviated by simply providing a fill line. Poor design.
customer_reviews.author: W in Md

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I am trying Cold Brew for the first time. It was so easy to make and delicious too! I bought this because of the discount and wow, it seals nicely and very easy to handle. Excellent product. ps: got a little blue light flash light in the package : BONUS!
customer_reviews.author: C. Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Ok the idea is sweet, but the actual process doesnt work. At all. Its like the filter works TOO well. I watched the video, followed the instructions, but unfortunately, the filter is so fine, that the water couldnt actually get thru to the coffee to let it steep. So after 16 hours the water just looked like tea, not cole brew concentrate. I would then have to pour the grounds directly into the water and let it steep AGAIN, and THEN pour it back thru the filter. So it didnt really save me any steps. Its going back :/
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Item
customer_reviews.text: I can get more iced coffee and just as good by brewing a pot of coffee, storing it in refrigerator and icing one glass at a time. This gadget uses quite a bit of ground coffee to produce very little. Takes many hours to cold brew. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: LaReina

customer_reviews.title: Less waste!
customer_reviews.text: After using this for about a month, I've noticed that we go through our coffee much more slowly. We generally use pre-ground store-bought coffee. It takes two cups of grounds per pot and lasts two of us ~3 days. Before this, we would make a pot of coffee every day, using approximately one cup of coffee every day. Since it's not sitting on the heat, it tastes much fresher even a few days later. It's easier to clean than a french press, and probably on par with a drip coffee pot. I hope this item keeps working as well as it has so far!
customer_reviews.author: gingersnap

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Can't say I'm terribly impressed considering all the raves. Main complaints : 1. As someone else pointed out, the chamber connects to the lid. This is a silly design and gets a bit messy. 2. Nothing seems to "thread" easily when trying to reconnect the pieces. I have to repeatedly try to catch a good turn to thread the pieces back together. This is quite annoying. I can't really say I would go back to this when the time comes to buy another one. I expected more for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Pardon Sardon

customer_reviews.title: Your life will never be the same
customer_reviews.text: I found this on a Buzzfeed article and decided to get it as a last minute, thoughtful but not expensive Christmas present for my husband. In all our 5 years together, I’m not sure I’ve ever bought him something he loved this much. We use it every single day, and we have an infant, so it’s constantly working overtime with us. It’s easy to use, and we just throw it in the dish washer once a week or so. (The truth is the truth, we basically empty it and just make more coffee.) Definitely worth it, and I’ve recommended it to all my coffee lover friends. Will buy ten more if something ever happens to it.
customer_reviews.author: K J

customer_reviews.title: Product leaks
customer_reviews.text: The instructions say to lay it on its side but the product leaks. You have to keep it upright. It caused a huge mess in my fridge. I don’t know the quality of the cold brew yet but I found that annoying. Especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Libolt

customer_reviews.title: Not a good experience
customer_reviews.text: I like to drink hot coffee, but I would like cold brew for a change from time to time. Whenever I try it, I told myself to return it because of the coffee ground go throught the infuser or filter, turn my cold drink into a bad experience at the end of the drink because I start to taste the coffee ground on the bottom of my cup. But the taste is good in the beginning and become unpleasant at the end. I ground the coffee as coasrse as instructed, and found out the more coarse the less taste of the coffee. I guess it is too late to return it, I bough it in Jan-2017
customer_reviews.author: bnngv

customer_reviews.title: Good idea for ice brew freaks
customer_reviews.text: As an avid drinker of iced coffee, I brewed the normal way of a coffee maker and chilled in the fridge overnight. Makes the coffee tart and acidic. Figured I would try one of these systems and the price seemed good for a trial. Definitely tastes much better with this system. The biggest bummer is the amount of coffee you use... 14tbl spooons for 32 ounces... whereas traditionally 4 scoops would equal 20 ounces. So... with that said it’s good, but costlier compared traditional hot brew method. But still cheaper than Starbucks etc Super easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Josh J.

customer_reviews.title: Great cold brew!
customer_reviews.text: So far this is awesome! My wife & I both drink iced coffee during the hotter months. I have only had this product a few days but have already fell in love with this. Was drinking the Starbucks dark cold brew. It makes an awesome substitute for less than a quarter of the price. Would highly recommend getting the big one like we did though
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life!
customer_reviews.text: This little filter is great. It makes the perfect amount of cold brew for a week for me. I usually steep for anywhere between 12-24 hours depending on how strong I want it to be. Grind your beans coarse and fill with filtered water and toss it in the fridge, can't be any simpler. I used to always drop $3-4 a day on iced coffee or the VSC cold brew from Starbuck's, so I can't imagine how much money this has saved me.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob S.

customer_reviews.title: The Size is Pointless
customer_reviews.text: I had the same issue as the other one star reviewers. You cant’t fill it all the way and are supposed to store this on its side which is awkward and the coffee grounds leaked massively into the coffee. You are left with a nasty sludge in your coffee. The filter is so large, when you remove it the liquid drops and you find you only have half a pitcher of coffee, making the larger sized pitcher absolutely pointless. Save your money and get a smaller pitcher.
customer_reviews.author: Cuesta Verde

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done well, but has a lot of flaws.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Flavor output is great. Extracts flavor from even the cheapest bag of ground beans. -Lasts me a week, if I'm conservative about how much I drink. -Great price. Cons: -The filter is made out of some type of fabric, and coffee residue accumulates over time. It also seems to be glued to the plastic, so wear and tear is inevitable. It's also difficult (not impossible) to clean, without worrying it'll break. -The price of one filter is a few dollars cheaper than the actual kit. That's kind of lame. -It doesn't actually yield that many cups as advertised (still enough for me to last a week, at least).
customer_reviews.author: Moses Kim

customer_reviews.title: better than french press. tastes great
customer_reviews.text: I have been doing cold brew at home with a french press for years but I am glad I picked this up. with this, the cold brew tastes more like something i'd buy at a high end coffee shop. I like being able to just pour and not have to worry about pressing. cleaning is about the same amount of mess you would get with a french press. These beans make for a fantastic combo:
customer_reviews.author: Eric G.

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great cup of cold brew but the filter is difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a new cold brew maker as the previous one I was using had rather flimsy glass. For the most part this cold brew is great and easy to use, however, the filter can be an absolute nightmare to clean depending on the grind you use. After my last batch of coarse grind I'm still left with a lot of leftover coffee grinds despite following the directions to clean it, soaking it, and also trying to run it through the dishwasher. Beside that headache though it does make a great cup of cold brew and is really easy to store the concentrate.
customer_reviews.author: Lost Whovian

customer_reviews.title: Filtering system not optimal
customer_reviews.text: Our household felt that the filter just isn’t big enough to allow the coffee grinds to do their thing so the flavor is compromised. The grinds expand enough to cram the filter holding in some of the goodness you’d otherwise get from letting the grinds swim around like free-range coffee. If you like your coffee on the lighter side and don’t want to filter yourself, this will do the trick. On the plus side, we love the pitcher and use it to start our cold brew (not using the filter, it’s easily removable) and then filter 2x ourselves to make a perfect blend. We’ll buy additional non-filter pitchers or use for infused water or iced tea.
customer_reviews.author: Pelligrino45

customer_reviews.title: Finally found my daily drink!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this brewer. Super simple to use and easy to clean. The only negative thing I would write is that the handle is a little flimsy. But, I’m pretty careful with my belongings. So, it’s not really an issue. The flavor is amazing when paired with cold brew lab coffee and sweet cream and vanilla syrup!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!!!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed in this item. I bought this after being at a friend’s who had this exact model and loved it. Unfortunately the one I received leaks all over the fridge if I lay it on it’s side (as the directions suggest). I tried opening and closing the lid several different times to make sure I didn’t miss the threading but to no avail. Still leaks. Really bummed because I was looking forward to being able to use this product daily and be able to store it upright or on its side.
customer_reviews.author: 808girl

customer_reviews.title: Saves money! Finally Decaf Cold Brew!!
customer_reviews.text: So I drink decaf due to GI issues but i still love coffee, iced cofeee in particular and NO one sells decaf cold brew coffee anywhere- which is a bummer. This is perfect because I buy my own quality bag of (water processed-it’s better less chemicals) decaffeinated coffee from Moto and use this pitcher and viola! I’m so happy I found it. I do have to use 15-16 tablespoons of (coarse) ground coffee though which is a lot but it provides me with 5 work days worth so it’s all good. Easy to use and clean. PS :The brewing process does take 12 hrs. And DO NOT pour your used grounds down your drain.
customer_reviews.author: Calireader

customer_reviews.title: I love this coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: I jumped on the bandwagon of cold brew coffee after trying this. It produces a very strong yet smooth cup of coffee that I now drink every morning. I add a little creamer and go from there. I think it says four cups but it makes about one and a half of my big tervis tumbler mugs. I drink in the morning, save the leftover for the next day and start the next one. 12 hours is minimum to get a good brew ( with the occasional shake and swirl) but leaving it for 24 hours until the next morning works too!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob November

customer_reviews.title: Awesome morning routine addition
customer_reviews.text: Works great cold brew coffee. Easy to clean and maintain. Hot tip: instead of adding the coffee grounds in the center piece to the water in the container, slowly add water to the container filter, funneling through the coffee grounds in the center filter piece. Otherwise, when you add the filter grounds to the water, the grounds tend to float and not brew properly.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Solfest

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This cold brewed coffee-make is so easy to use and to clean. I'v only had it a couple of weeks and it's great. Easy to put the grounds into filter without spilling. Also, grounds do not leak from the filer to the liquid or spill into the liquid when the container is opened to remove the spent grounds. Best of all - the flavor is awesome. I first bought a different brand and wasn't happy. It was difficult to fill, the grounds leaked through the metal filter and very messy when trying to pour from container into a glass or cup.
customer_reviews.author: SHamms

customer_reviews.title: I am now a full cold brew convert.
customer_reviews.text: I am now a full cold brew convert. This little pitcher yields 2 days of coffee for me. I really love being able to get it ready in the evening so that in the morning before work, I just need to pour and go. I expected it to leak a little when shaken and swirled, but the seal is excellent. Plus, at this size, it fits perfectly in the door of my fridge. Also, it's super easy to clean. Part of me wishes that it were larger, but because it's so easy to use, I don't mind having to wash and fill it every couple days. I will never buy coffee shop coffee again thanks to this pitcher.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa LaRose

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: This has worked well for me. I have noticed the same thing others mention about the ground coffee rising to the top of the filter and not all being used, and I've considered whether there's some way to weight it. Unfortunately, the screw-on lid to mine has mysteriously disappeared, and since I can't find a replacement part, I'm going to have to order an entire new one.
customer_reviews.author: Jilly of the Valley

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase Ever!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm the type that buys an iced coffee every single day. I don't like how with other coffee makers that claim to make 'iced' coffee, you have to brew it hot first and then pour over ice, it just isn't the same. This product is PERFECT. It makes great cold brew coffee, whicked easy to clean and it comes out fantastic. I was worried about getting bits of coffee grounds in my coffee, but the filter in this is awesome and this is perfect to help me make coffee at home and start saving some money! Definitely worth it and its a great price! Definitely would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: filter rips too easily
customer_reviews.text: I loved this infuser when I first got it and started using that I bought 2 more (I drink a lot of coffee). And one by one, the filter in all 3 would rip/tear and I would get coffee grounds in my coffee. They sell replacement filters for $8 each, but if I have to keep buying those after 3 or 4 uses, what's the point. So that's why it's so much cheaper than other cold brew carafes. Time to splurge on a better, more expensive one that hopefully has longer lasting filter.
customer_reviews.author: ATB

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: OK, I so I've only used my cold brew system one time so far because it just arrived yesterday. I just wanna say that the flavor of the cold brew is beyond my expectations. It's far better than hot coffee and I enjoy hot coffee very much. I may be over hot coffee for a while if that gives you any idea. The product is made of plastic and very well constructed, so far no leaks. I hope it lasts a long time but it's so reasonably priced that even if it didn't I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: cmc6921

customer_reviews.title: Great way to make excellent cold brew.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and a good value. This simple device makes excellent cold brew in about 24 hours. As other reviewers have noted the lid is not 100% water tight so store it upright in your fridge but hey, that's what I would do anyway. I occasionally agitate it while brewing to wash more brew through the beans. If you grind your own beans a conical grinder is the way to go and you really should grind them on a very coarse setting or sediment will wash through the filter and get into your brew. I am very happy with this simple cold brew system.
customer_reviews.author: IDOC

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase, would reccomend.
customer_reviews.text: I just got this in over the weekend and had my first brew this morning. It tastes great! I was pleasantly surprised. It's my 1st cold brew maker and I wasn't sure what to expect. I wanted something simple and easy and it seems to be both. A bit smaller than I thought, but it makes about a quart and will give you multiple drinks per brew so it's enough for an average drinker. The basket is big and takes up some of the water space, which is maybe why it is less liquid, but it allows you to have more or less grounds and make it to your desired level of strength. Not bitter tasting.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Grounds
customer_reviews.text: This is literally a godsend and has saved me so much money! The only reason why I’m not giving it five stars is having some of the course grounds sneaking into my coffee occasionally but it doesn’t hinder the taste or anything, just an observation. I haven’t had a problem with all of the grounds getting wet even if I put in the filter after the water. They do rise to the top at first but after you shake it to start the diffusion, they all seem to drop, at least for me. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great way to make delicious coffee for cheap
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one device, and it was great. Worked as expected, about $3.50 US to make a liter of the best coffee (concentrate) I ever had. Problem was, there was that 1-2 days of clean/brew that I was without. So I ordered a second unit. However the molding process of the cap was faulty, and didn't let the seal seal properly. In the process of a replacement now. Besides the 50/50 QC, good product. If you buy this, first fill with water and shake the crap out of it. If no leaks, your likely going to give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Can’t live without this cold brewer now.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this multiple times. Originally recommended by a friend and now we can’t live without it! So easy to use and no bitterness. Only problem is we go through the cold brew so fast I usually put it in a separate pitcher so I can start brewing the next batch so we never run out!. We ended up using it so much I had to buy my daughter her own to take to college. The pitcher is plastic and I was initially disappointed but it turns out it is so much better in plastic and easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: PATRICIA NANCE

customer_reviews.title: Consistent and Durable!
customer_reviews.text: Great product - works exactly as it should. I have done lots of research into cold brew pitchers and have found most other products - even more expensive, “expert” ones - to fail. Either the size of the carafe is off or the filter is too fine or too loose. But this one is PERFECT. It is durable, has a strong seal, and is easy to clean. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Great intro to cold brew preparation!
customer_reviews.text: I am new to preparing cold brew so I wanted to start small. This brewer is a great way to start! Preparation is super easy and clean up is a breeze. For the coffee, I used McCafe premium roast and the end result was a rich and robust brew that tasted better than cold brew purchased from expensive coffee shops. Mix with milk and sugar and you'll have an iced latte from the best coffee shop in America, your home kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: WillsReviews

customer_reviews.title: Great cold brew for a fraction of coffee prices
customer_reviews.text: I gotta tell you after missing my Starbucks cold brew For the past month I’m loving this system! Super easy to use. I didn’t use a coarse grind just normal Folgers. It has great smooth taste no bitterness and after 12 hours it is very bold! And this thing doesn’t leak!! I’m considering one for a juice pitcher just to use it normally. I do find though it’s too tall to stand up in the highest shelf in my fridge, but it can lay down no problem! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Karlei Hill

customer_reviews.title: Should Have Bought This Sooner!!!
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought this ages ago. It’s so easy to make! The coffee is so smooth! Supposedly it will keep Coffee fresh for two weeks. I doubt any coffee made in this pitcher will make it that long, so I can’t vouch for that. I do like that it’s plastic—I was on the fence and almost bought glass, but I have small kids and that would stress me out having them opening the fridge and digging around in there. This fits in my fridge door nicely. Very happy with this pitcher!
customer_reviews.author: Kami C

customer_reviews.title: Girlfriend's new favorite
customer_reviews.text: My old lady LOVES this thing, likely more than me. This is the best purchase I've made in some time. You put it mediocre coffee grounds and you end up with pretty decent cold brew. I suspect it'd be amazing with good coffee, but it does use a lot of grounds to make a quart. Super easy to use. Fill 3/4 with water, fill filter with 14 rounded tablespoons of grounds. Assemble unit, shake, refrigerate. I give it an extra shake about 12 hours in. 24 hours after you started, you've got good cold brew. Shake again immediately before you serve. Add a little cream and you've got "some serious gourmet sh*t".
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: DON’T PURCHASE FOR ICED COFFEE
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this plastic iced coffee pitcher for traveling, but it is horrible. I have used this twice & both times the coffee ends up with coffee grounds in the liquid and the taste is not good, almost plastic tasting. I wish I would have traveled and used this before my return window was up because I would have returned this for a full refund. I would not recommend this to anyone wanting to make iced coffee, I hate this thing. It is going in the trash and I am sticking with my glass iced coffee container!
customer_reviews.author: Jodie Marburger

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this twice since getting it and overall it works pretty well! I'm still working on the ratio of grounds to use and how long to brew in the fridge to get the taste that I like, but the actual pitcher is great! The seals are strong making it easy to shake around without leakage. I wish I would have found this earlier when it started warming up outside, but I'm glad I have it now! This would also make a great pitcher to make infused water, or just to put any drinks in without the mesh filter.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Essential to my coffee addiction!
customer_reviews.text: Been using this more than my espresso machine! So easy to use and make! Although some grounds do come out when you fill it with too much water. I suggest not filling it up too much, stirring the grounds with the water inside before storing, and pouring it slowly to avoid the ground coming up. Also, once in a while, tap the bottom of the container down to push the grounds down in the filter so it doesn't stay too high up. Great cold brew maker. Definitely smooth and tasty. Remember, the grounds is what will make the taste.
customer_reviews.author: imlawrencehi

customer_reviews.title: Shake it up!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this brewer. One thing, before you put a new batch in the fridge, make sure you turn it upside down and shake. This will make sure you saturate all the grounds and you won’t waste as much. Make sure the lid is on tight!!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Evelle

customer_reviews.title: Love this!!!
customer_reviews.text: Been using this almost every week since we bought it. Awesome to have iced coffee at home. So far dark roast has been my favorite. We just hand wash the whole thing. Rinses clean.
customer_reviews.author: kathryn21

customer_reviews.title: Better than a mason jar for cold brew
customer_reviews.text: There's a time in your adult life you start to purchase very specific kitchen tools because as much as you wanna make do, having the right tool for the job saves a lot of time and energy if you use it a lot. So if you like having cold brew around all the time, this does the job. It's better than having to filter the grounds out of a mason jar and eventually have to wash two mason jars. And if you're considering buying an avocado slicer because you eat 10 avocados a day, go for it. You're an adult now with adult money.
customer_reviews.author: AdaBanana

customer_reviews.title: Good iced coffee at home
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I decided to get this iced coffee maker. Previously I was using mason jars and cheesecloth to assemble, steep, and strain my iced coffee. This all-in-one makes the process simple and there's no more mess. I make iced coffee concentrate about once a week and it lasts me for about 5-6 days depending on how I put together my drink that day. I steep my coffee grounds with brown sugar and cinnamon. I like that this brewer is easy to clean. It can go in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey K

customer_reviews.title: Good. Not Great.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and shape of pitcher - fits in refrigerator well. Handle is sturdy and pours well. I do have a couple complaints though: Somehow lots of sediment/grinds get into the finished product. You many need to strain it sometimes which negates the benefit of using this to begin with. If you don't strain, there is always black sludge on the bottom of the pitcher. Really need to agitate and shake a LOT during brew cycle or just don't get a good flavor/intensity. Water just can't circulate easily through the tightly packed grounds when making a full batch.
customer_reviews.author: P. Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee bitter free
customer_reviews.text: Using it was so easy and the hardest part is the waiting. Easy to use, just fill it up with water and then add coffee grounds to the filter and then seal it up, shake and wait. Cleaning was simple too, dump out the coffee grounds, you can also use them as fertilizer. Add soap and water, seal it back and shake shake shake and rinse. I also used this with boiling water and it works great. No spills at all and seals it up air tight.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Chow

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy it is to use. I've made 2 carafes of cold brew coffee and it's great. It cleans up beautifully and the coffee is delicious. Very smooth and so strong that I can mix it with water and have great tasting iced or hot coffee.I haven't had any trouble brewing coffee as others have indicated. I do pour some water thru the filter opening filled with dry coffee and then finish filling the carafe to the indicated level. Put it in the fridge and once or twice I shake it up. Out comes great tasting coffee.
customer_reviews.author: ccas

customer_reviews.title: Works for coffee and tea
customer_reviews.text: We own two pitchers. We use one for coffee and one for tea. By the way, there is no difference in using the same pitcher. When you order the coffee brewer and read the bottom of the filter, the filter is for tea. When you order the tea filter, it is identical to the “coffee” filter which is for tea. Don’t overthink it, you can use it for both!!! My mom had the pitcher and I ordered her the filter. She absolutely loves her cold brew in the morning now!
customer_reviews.author: AMYANN

customer_reviews.title: Several days worth of iced coffee, takes up little space, easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: UGH. Love this so much! Still trying to figure out which coffee I like best. I found that I will make coffee the night before I need it, pour what I want for the day, then add more water and let it steep another 24 hours until I’m ready for more. I’m able to use one “serving” of grounds for 3-4 days before replacing them! Saves me so much money so I’m not treating myself to Starbucks as frequently and is very easy and quick to hand wash. Also doesn’t take up a ton of space in the fridge. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Simple to Use
customer_reviews.text: This iced coffee maker is amazing! I have not experienced any leaks but have been storing it upright in my refrigerator. Some of the coffee grounds Do float to the top inside the filter, I remedy this by swirling and tapping the filter and lid inside the pitcher to settle and mix the coffee. I fill the filter just to the top of the mesh to make a good strong brew. It equals about 1.25 cups of course ground coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Brown

customer_reviews.title: great for acid reflux
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as soon as I was diagnosed with acid reflux bc I am NOT giving up coffee. I even bought some chicory to bring the acidity down even further. I'm a little confused by the weird instructions that say not to lay it on its side while hot, since it shouldn't be headed anyway. Maybe they mean after it comes out of the dishwasher?? What's gonna happen? Is it gonna melt? explode? Aside from a slight durability concern, everything seems great. Perfect for the price. I noted to other reviewer's comment about the design flaw for the 2 quart, so I went with the 1 quart. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Fan Dango

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee & simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend the Takeya cold brew maker. It's simple to use and easy to clean. Combined with a quality burr coffee grinder, the filter tube has this amazingly fine filter material that does a good job straining the grounds while letting water permeate the grounds thoroughly. I use a 30 setting on my Baratza Virtuoso grinder, about 14-15 Tbs of coffee with RO filtered water. Leave in fridge for 2.5 days, results are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: TomS

customer_reviews.title: The coffee came out great but a lot of grinds got through the filter
customer_reviews.text: I've used this twice. Instructions say 14-16 tablespoons, 16 tablespoons = 1 cup. It would have been easier if they had just said that. The coffee came out great but a lot of grinds got through the filter. I bought and had the coffee grounded at Starbucks and the barista seemed to know exactly how the beans should be grinded - "Coarse, french press", when I told her what I would be using the coffee fore. I will try an even more coarsely ground coffee next time. I also found that shaking it more gently helped with the grounds getting through the filter (as expected).
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, does it's job and dishwasher safe
customer_reviews.text: pros The packaging says it's 100% dishwasher safe. It's easy to use and put together and make cold brew pretty quickly. Cons Opening for the coffee tube is kinda small and I spilled a bunch on my first try. Other I think the manufacturer should consider putting a line/marker on where the water should be and possibly also where the coffee should be on the sleeve. Would sure make measuring it out easier.
customer_reviews.author: rjb

customer_reviews.title: Great for DIY cold brews!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cold brew container! Makes enough for about 3 days! Letting it sit for 24 hours gives you the perfect strength. Watch how much grounds you add though.. first time I followed the instructions and that brew put hair on my chest! Lol I grind my own beans.. and add 5 tablespoons. Super easy clean up with the mesh center. Easy to grab and go for work mornings!
customer_reviews.author: Dina Trizzino

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: I got this based of reviews on Amazon and a website that reviewed many cold-brew coffee makers. The ease of use was nice. You.load up the cylinder with coffee, add water, and wait for your coffee. What I didn't like was the weak coffee concentrate it made, the fact that it left quite a bit of sediment, and how messy it was trying to clean the cylinder. I will likely give this as a gift to someone and continue to use my Toddy system for cold-brew coffee concentrate.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Zograph

customer_reviews.title: That dang treading...
customer_reviews.text: My biggest problem with this is how hard it is to screw on the extender. If you don't line the treading up perfectly, it's super annoying. Then you are supposed to remove the coffee grounds after so many hours and that's a but messy. Also, you initially brew the coffee on it's side overnight before standing it upright so make sure you have space for that. I have brewed it standing upright once and I don't really taste a difference but if you like to follow directions, have space ready. Sturdy product, no leaks, shipped well and on time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Leung

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! Works amazingly well. Don't know why people complain. If there are mold mark issues, trim them. I grind my own grounds in my magic bullet, add 12-14 tbsp (about 1 cup) to the center diffuser, pour all the water thru the diffuser into the pitcher, seal it up, and viola! Perfect every time. Then I pour it out into a half gallon pitcher, clean it, and start again! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wess Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. First time with cold brewing. Nice and compact for my small fridge. I usually refill it with ozarka water after emptying it out from 24hr extraction. Let the same grounds sit for another 24hrs. The effect of caffine is reduced while getting the most out of the coffee grounds. Experimenting with different types of liquid; fruit juice, almond milk, soy milk, coconut milk and let it brew with the grounds. Talk about time saver.
customer_reviews.author: leo da dominico

customer_reviews.title: Buy!  It's THAT good!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AMAZING! Ive been making cold brew a couple of years using a nut milk bag and this little pitcher is so much easier to use and clean I'm kicking myself for not having it earlier! It couldn't be more simple. Add coffee to the filter. Fill pitcher about 3/4 full of water. Screw on lid. Put in fridge and wait 24 hours I follow the directions to put the pitcher on it's side while it's "brewing" and and it never leaks. When done, dump the grounds, rinse the filter and enjoy. Have suggested this to all my friends and will buy again when/ if this ever breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Karen W

customer_reviews.title: Makes a very nice tasting cold brew!
customer_reviews.text: What this cold brewer has going for it is its simplicity. I've brewed several cold brew batches in it and have been quite pleased with the result. My first batch was a bit too weak, as I only ground the amount of beans I typically grind for my French press. For my next batch I doubled the quantity of beans to almost completely fill the mesh basket. This time my cold brew was fantastic! I highly recommend this cold brewer. It's easy to use and clean, and it functions great.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Macomber

customer_reviews.title: Makes a batch of cold brew overnight - right size for refrigerator - easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This item is easy to use, with a little experimentation. I do not like my coffee very strong, so it took me a couple of try's to arrive at the right amount of coffee for me. I now fill the filter half way with coffee and leave to brew over night in the refrigerator. In the morning I remove the filter and have enough coffee to last at least three days (I am the only one in the house who drinks it). The filter cleans easily with a bottle brush. Overall, a winner. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ulnvrgs

customer_reviews.title: COLD BREW MADE EASY
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A EASY WAY TO HAVE COLD BREW WITHOUT PAYING BIG BUCKS PROBABLY PAYS FOR ITSELF IN TWO BATCHES IT IS A LITTLE ON THE SMALL SIZE WHICH IS A PLUS IF YOU DONT HAVE A LOT OF ROOM IN YOUR FRIDGE I LIKE REALLY STRONG COFFE SO I GENERALLY STEEP MINE AT LEAST 24 AND SOMETIMES 48 HOURS I HAVE ANOTHER SMALL PITCHER THAT CAME WITH MY KEURIG AND I POUR THE FINISHED BATCH IN IT AND THEN I CAN HAVE ANOTHER BATCH STEEPING WHILE I DRINK THAT BATCH VERY PLEASED OVERALL GREAT BANG FOR YOUR BUCK BTW THE BIZZY COLD BREW COFFEE WORKS PERFECT IN THIS UNIT
customer_reviews.author: RAP

customer_reviews.title: Loce
customer_reviews.text: Okay this is my favorite thing I have bought! I wanted a way to make my old cold brew and have it readily available when I wanted it without having to buy gallons of it at the store’ this does exactly what I want and is so easy to use! I wish I got the bigger size due to how much ice coffee I am drinking now but Highly recommend! I’ll probably buy the bigger one for cold brew and use this one now for ice tea!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Zentz

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, saves money and time!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to save money on coffee in the morning, it has already paid for itsself. This cold brew maker is SO easy to use, just fill it and put it in the fridge overnight. Very easy to clean. The coffee ends up being a coffee concentrate so depending on how strong you want the coffee it will need to be diluted by water/cream/cream substitute, but the coffee is perfect. It's just enough for my boyfriend and I to split in the morning. Highly recommended for anyone who has been spending way too much on coffee every morning.
customer_reviews.author: KatieDinz

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This makes amazing cold brew. I make a new pot every night (I’m a big coffee drinker) it saves me so much money as it’s as good if not better than Starbucks cold brew. I like to use a med roast in this and put it in the fridge 20 hours or on the counter top for 12. I combined my cold brew with some sweet cream and a little bit of vanilla and it is even better than Starbucks vanilla sweet cream cold brew which costs over $6 for a venti. Amazing product for avid cold brew drinkers.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I have completely given up Starbucks after buying this. This is great if you love cold brew (which I didn’t know the difference but it’s less acidic and great for iced coffee which is my favorite). It does take a while to figure out your personal specifics to suit your tastes but once you do it’s awesome! To clean, you just run it through the dishwasher. If you’re a serious coffee drinker this is a great way to save money!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Great, enormous, makes coldbrew to last a week
customer_reviews.text: Pro-tips: --Use coarse ground coffee, and don't "pack it in" as you want the grind to soak/percolate. --Use single origin for more accurate and identifiable flavor. --Set up Saturday midday if you'd like to drink Mon-Friday. --"Waste" the last 2 ounces as they will contain a lot of sediment --Make sure that you have a very tall space in your fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Landau

customer_reviews.title: Perfect... enjoying my little pot immensely... :)
customer_reviews.text: Love my little cold-brew coffee pot... it’s my first venture into making cold brewed coffee... coffee taste so much better and less acidic than other options... this size is perfect for me... I typically brew in the fridge for 12 to 18 hours and then Intypically use half a mug And fill the rest up with water... works out to 3 cups for the day... which works out perfect for me... I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: RJR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect but just a few downsides
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee maker, however, it doesn't actually fit as much water/ coffee as you would think since the middle part takes up quite a bit of space. After taking it out your left with maybe 2 servings of coffee. My solution was to make the coffee a lot stronger and add more water after taking the middle out. After adding more water you want it to sit a little longer though. I also poured the water through the coffee grounds before attaching it to the lid. It helps speed up the brewing process and helps soak and sift through all the grounds.
customer_reviews.author: kathryne anderson

customer_reviews.title: Works Really Well
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive this and give cold brewing a try. I tend to prefer hot coffee but my daughter was drinking very expensive cold coffees from the grocery store and I thought this would be a good and cheaper alternative. I like the occasional cold coffee but not as much as she does. This works really well although even with course ground coffee we have discovered we still have to do a filter into a second carafe to get all the solids out. Ultimately I think there might be more efficient ways of doing this but this works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stop spending money, make cold brew @ home!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is saving me SO much money! Before this product I was a frequent flyer at Starbucks. Every day before work I would buy a vanilla sweet cream cold brew and it was costing nearly $20 per week. NOT ANYMORE!!! This pitcher is easy to clean, super easy to use. It keeps my coffee fresh-tasting even after 3 days in the fridge... I can't say enough good things about it!
customer_reviews.author: Allyson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and coffee tastes great!
customer_reviews.text: This cold brew coffee maker works perfectly. We've used it for about 3 months, and we suggest giving it a nice, violent shake before placing it in the refrigerator to steep. You really don't need to mess with it anymore after that. Just leave it in there until the next morning - or whatever 24 hours later is for you. You can't beat cold brew coffee if you don't like the acidity in normal brewing, and this little contraption is easy to use, and it makes coffee so smooth. Except for Starbucks. That still tastes like you're licking an ashtray, BUT most other coffees get a nice facelift.
customer_reviews.author: KC Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Great Product but One Regret
customer_reviews.text: First of all, this is a simple but very well made product. It is fairly priced and works great. Plus I am saving money versus ordering Starbucks bottles. But due to my ability to make great tasting cold brew at home, I am drinking more of it. So I do wish I would have bought the 2 quart size. I often find myself in a situation where I do not have a full serving left and its not like hot coffee where you can make another pot in a few minutes. Planning ahead of consumption is a key with cold brew.
customer_reviews.author: Neal S.

customer_reviews.title: Husband Loves It
customer_reviews.text: My husband has always complained that he would rather have cold coffee so for awhile, we'd make hot coffee then put it in the fridge to cool overnight. I saw a deal on this and decided to go for it. We love it! Easy to use and clean. We usually leave it for 24 hours then use it for about a week. It's so quick to clean and make another batch that we don't feel inconvenienced by it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Good for what you need done.
customer_reviews.text: I dislike that when I have the coffee brewed & I go to pour it, it leaks from where it screws together a little and the pour isn’t a smooth stream it’s like a spattering pour. It did good brewing the coffee quickly though & clear instructions. Would recommend it but I would like if someone had a review that told me about the way it doesn’t pour smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Private Name

customer_reviews.title: Most reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gadget. I've sadly bought this twice over. I got a glass-canistered iced coffee maker as a Christmas gift so I decided to move on from my first Takeya (gave it to my sister). I regretted it because somehow the rim of the glass canister part started to grind against the top as I was twisting it. That's when I noticed, it wasn't safe since I noticed a crack on it. So I was forced to buy a new Takeya. It's an old reliable! Plus cold brew is easy on the stomach and making it yourself saves you plenty of cash!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Y

customer_reviews.title: For all the coffee lovers out there!...
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first as I never knew such a product existed until I came across this. The positive reviews and advertised sale price was a deal breaker. Should've bought the 2 quart size. I love cold brew and this tastes just the same as buying a cup of this at Dunkin or Starbucks. Add your own favorite coffee grounds and you are on your way to a great cup of cold brew!!! Save so much money this way.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Moy

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift Great Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Get the 2qrt! We love the blonde roasted espresso from Starbucks, we get a bag of beans have them french press grind them, using a cup and just over a half, we brew on the counter per instructions for 20–24hours (we like it a bit stronger), and chill! Smooth delish coffee! The pitcher has never leaked, super easy to make. Parts are well made filter doesnt allow particles only a bit of coffee dust if u self grind to small. Makes a great gift!!!
customer_reviews.author: ShaleeB

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but terrible taste
customer_reviews.text: This carafe seemed like something that would make cold brewing at home easy but it ended up being disappointing. I ground the beans coarsely and let them steep for 24 hrs before tasting. It was extremely weak coffee! I let it steep for another 24hrs and it was really no better. It was easy to use but the flavor was not at all concentrated. I guess I'm going back to straining my cold brew the old school way.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome pitcher. You fill the center with coffee and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome pitcher. You fill the center with coffee and the outside with water, and pop it into the fridge. At first, I thought it used an awful lot of coffee grinds to make what didn't look like a very big pot of coffee. Then, I realized it makes "concentrate," and you add water and ice to it to drink. You're basically getting double what the pot looks like it makes. I was really impressed with the cold-brewed flavor. It took away all the bitterness, and left a smooth cuppa. The pot itself fits nicely on the refrigerator door as well. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and the coffee tastes good. I use half and half, no sweetener. This method lets the creaminess of the half and half shine through. Two difficulties: If you don't want to send coffee grounds down your drain (I don't) it is hard to empty the filter. Second: The large, protruding handle makes it hard to screw the top on or off, and makes it necessary to turn the maker sideways in the refrigerator door to let the door close properly. Also, it uses 3 times as much coffee grounds to make about 30% more coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Listening

customer_reviews.title: Grounds in the pitcher!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve noticed that there are grounds in the cold brew almost right after I add the coffee to the filter and put it into the pitcher with the 32 ounces of water. I have to buy cheesecloth to filter out the grounds before I can drive k the coffee. Is this the way it’s supposed to work? If so, I’m not really pleased with the inconvenience of this.
customer_reviews.author: Hello Kitty Fan

customer_reviews.title: After months of debating, finally decided to get this
customer_reviews.text: Been wanting to get a cold brew maker. Was looking at another brand that is glass. Finally decided to get the Takeya. It's priced less and if I (most likely will) accidentally drop it, it won't be shattered. I hope! So far, I've brewed 2 times. Each time, 24 hrs. I must say, I'm impressed. Flavor is there, even using older coffee grinds and cheaper ones. Simple to make. Very happy with the purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Too

customer_reviews.title: Best cold brew container in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. The filter is such a wonderful fine mesh that it keeps the fine ground particles out of the brew. I use this non-stop as it delivers the best results, and none of that metallic taste I find so often w/ metal strainers. So very easy to use, and easy to clean too. The lid fits tight and it is true to the description that you can store it on its side and it will not leak. I have the larger containers from this company and find the inserts are transferable from one to another with ease. Highly recommended for any cold brew enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: CassWolf

customer_reviews.title: Makes weak cold brew
customer_reviews.text: Meh. I feel like the filter is too fine for what makes good cold brew. I think the coffee grinds to water ratio is off. This always makes a very diluted brew. When I make it with grinds directly into the water and filter out, it tastes SO much better just more work. I will continue to use it but it doesn't make cold brew concentrate. It makes it ready to drink of weak is your preference.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary King

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for making coffee overnight!
customer_reviews.text: This is great to make coffee overnight and have ready in the morning. Would be better if the singer had a marking or “fill to line” so I don’t have to use measuring cups every day. Seems like a simple design change for future versions.
customer_reviews.author: Ivette Muller

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the description said that cold brew coffee has 60% less acid, and I have stomach issues. The coffee is excellent. I have mainly used it to make iced coffee. To make hot coffee you add the cold brew to boiling water. Use about a 50/50 ratio. Do not use with whole beans unless you grind them first - your coffee will be super weak. I may be getting rid of my coffee maker! :)
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Love this cold brew pitcher
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so that I wouldn't have to ice my regular brew in order to have iced coffee. I always thought that cold brew would be too acidic based on the amount of coffee that is used. But I've found the opposite. This pitcher is well made, easy to use and clean. It fits easily in my fridge and the cold brew is magnificent. I'm buying a second one to keep at my office.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M

customer_reviews.title: A very happy barista at home
customer_reviews.text: I love this little brewer! For my personal use it’s perfect. It makes a batch of cold brew that lasts me a few days! The mesh filter it comes with is awesome as well, a nice bonus! I ordered separate small cold brew filter bags as well to make it even easier to clean up since I usually get grinds everywhere when dumping them from the filter the brewer comes with. If you are making cold brew for more than 2-3 people, you might want to get the larger model. Have fun making cold brew at home, find YOUR perfect beans to make a tasty cup of cold brew and save money
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Overall one of the best  coffee makers I have seen.
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like ? This is one of the best coffee makers I have ever seen. I love the look and the design. It has a seal which is a huge plus , coffee or tea is not exposed to the elements of your fridge Your beverage will last longer because of the screw on cap. It's mostly plastic which I like because lets face it if something is glass it will break more easily if you drop it. Overall no complaints. I have not had this long however the true test would be if someone had this for a year and see how well everything held up after and wrote a review. :)
customer_reviews.author: Abraham the vampire apprentice

customer_reviews.title: If you like cold brew coffee, this is for you.
customer_reviews.text: We use cold brew coffee for iced drinks, milkshakes, smoothies. This filter/pitcher system is ingenious and very easy to use. It takes one minute to loosely fill the filter cone with coarse-ground coffee of your choice and fill the pitcher with water. Then let it sit overnight, shake it and use it. No leaks from this pitcher! The quality of the result will depend on the quality of coffee you put in it, this system produces a very true-tasting coffee.
customer_reviews.author: JaeMae

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for cold brew lovers
customer_reviews.text: We love this cold brew coffee maker. The mesh in the inner compartment (where the grounds go) is fine enough to prevent grounds from getting into your coffee. The container itself is super convenient. We typically brew the coffee for 48 hours, then transfer it to another container and start the next batch. Definitely pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen A.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: This cold brew maker is very easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: This cold brew maker is very easy to use and clean. The directions are very straight forward. All you have to do is put coffee ground into the filter provided, swirl the filter around a few times in the water, and wait overnight. Then you will wake up in the morning and have delicious cold brew coffee to drink! We liked this product so much, we bought another, so that there would be no waiting period between batches. The only negative is that you will get some coffee particles floating around, but we have been pouring though a filter to try and decrease the amount.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Should have gotten it sooner
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little container to make cold brew in. Ended up buying two of the containers so I can brew another container before I run out of the one. Instructions say to brew while it is on its side but I brew it standing up right. I don't make the full 2 qts of coffee so upright works just fine for me. Second container I received requires a little more tightening of the top but I can gaurentee you it's airtight. I shake our coffee daily and I get no leaks. Take good care of it and hand wash only. Should last a really long time.
customer_reviews.author: RabidEwok

customer_reviews.title: So easy and convenient
customer_reviews.text: I love how simple and easy this iced coffee maker is. Just fill the pitcher with water (almost the top), fill the filter with ground coffee, place it in the pitcher, and let it sit in the fridge overnight. By the morning, my iced coffee is ready to be enjoyed. One pitcher lasts me 3 cups. I have a cup a day so I remake it every 3 days. Super convenient since I don’t have to make coffee every single day. It also saves me time in the morning since it’s pre-made.
customer_reviews.author: Jheneya

product_meta.title: Takeya Patented Deluxe Cold Brew Coffee Maker, One Quart, Black

Once brewed, concentrated coffee can be kept fresh in the TAKEYA airtight Cold Brew Coffee Maker for up to 2 weeks and used for both hot and iced coffees. Do not freeze or microwave
